openadk.library.impl
Class HttpTransport

java.lang.Object
  openadk.library.impl.TransportImpl
      openadk.library.impl.HttpTransport
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, Transport
public class HttpTransport
extends TransportImpl

Transport class for the HTTP and HTTPS protocols.

One instance of HttpTransport is shared among all zones that use the HTTP or HTTPS protocols. When activated, it creates an internal Jetty HTTP/HTTPS web server for use by all zones the agent is connected to using these protocols. Each zone then instantiates its own HttpProtocolHandler, which is responsible for sending and receiving messages. (The HttpTransport class does not send or receive messages.)

Because many SIF Agents may use the ADK, no default HTTP or HTTPS port is assigned to push mode agents by the class framework. It is the developer's responsibility to assign a default port (pull-mode agents do not require a port be assigned.) To do so, use one of the following methods:

  • Set the adk.transport.http.port system property prior to creating your agent's Zones and/or Topics. This property can be set programmatically by calling the System.setProperty method, or via the -D option on the Java command-line.
  • Call the setPort method on the default HttpProperties and/or HttpsProperties objects prior to creating your agent's Zones and/or Topics. The following block of code demonstrates:

    // Set transport properties for HTTP
    Agent myAgent = ...
    HttpProperties http = agent.getDefaultHttpProperties();
    http.setPort( 7081 );

    // Set transport properties for HTTPS
    HttpsProperties https = agent.getDefaultHttpsProperties();
    https.setPort( 7082 );
    https.setKeystorePassword( "changeit" );
    ...

Version:
ADK 1.0
Author:
Eric Petersen

Method Detail

cloneTransport

public Transport cloneTransport()
                         throws ADKTransportException
Clone this HttpTransport.

Cloning a transport results in a new HttpTransport instance with HttpProperties that inherit from this object's properties. However, the Jetty web server owned by this transport will be shared with the cloned instance.

Returns:
A clone of the current transport
Throws:
ADKTransportException

getServer

public org.mortbay.http.HttpServer getServer()
Gets the internal Jetty HTTP/HTTPS server. The server is used by all instances of the HttpTransport for both HTTP and HTTPS communications with the ZIS.

Returns:
The Jetty HttpServer object

setPort

public void setPort(int port)
Sets the local port this transport protocol will use when listening for incoming traffic from the ZIS. The port is assigned to the TransportProperties object passed to the constructor.

Parameters:
port - The port number

Returns:
The port number returned by the TransportProperties object passed to the constructor

setHost

public void setHost(java.lang.String host)
Sets the local hostname this transport protocol will use when listening for incoming traffic from the ZIS. By default, localhost is assumed. The hostname is assigned to the TransportProperties object passed to the constructor.

Parameters:
host - The host name used for this protocol

getKeyStore

public java.lang.String getKeyStore()
Gets the keystore file this transport protocol will use for HTTPS.

This method has no effect if HttpsProperties were not passed to the constructor.

Returns:
The keystore file returned by the HttpProperties passed to the constructor

setKeyStore

public void setKeyStore(java.lang.String keyStore)
Sets the keystore file this transport protocol will use for HTTPS. This method has no effect if HttpsProperties were not passed to the constructor.

Parameters:
keyStore - The path to a keystore file. The keystore value is assigned to the HttpsProperties passed to the constructor.

getKeyStorePassword

public java.lang.String getKeyStorePassword()
Gets the keystore password this transport protocol will use when setting up HTTPS.

This method has no effect if HttpsProperties were not passed to the constructor.

Returns:
The keystore password returned by the HttpsProperties passed to the constructor

setKeyStorePassword

public void setKeyStorePassword(java.lang.String keyStorePass)
Sets the keystore password this transport protocol will use when setting up HTTPS. This value does not apply to HTTP connections. The keystore password value is assigned to the HttpProperties passed to the constructor.

Parameters:
keyStorePass - the keystore password

getPassword

public java.lang.String getPassword()
Gets the key password this transport protocol will use when setting up HTTPS. When a null value is returned, the caller should use the same password as the keystore password. This value does not apply to HTTP connections.

Returns:
The key password returned by the HttpProperties passed to the constructor

setPassword

public void setPassword(java.lang.String pass)
Sets the key password this transport protocol will use when setting up HTTPS. It is typically the same as the keystore password. This value does not apply to HTTP connections. The key password is assigned to the HttpProperties passed to the constructor.

Parameters:
pass - the key password
